title: tonynewham
author: tonynewham
content: Hello you very wonderful and intelligent people that make up this forum, i truly hope you are doing well and having a very positive week.I was interested in signing up to Mega.nz to store lots of personal medical information, personal identification documents and business related files, such as finance data and website designs with scripts. I would like to retain some anonymity as this is the reason i dont want to consider Dropbox as they scan your files and you dont know how secure the Cloud storage is. I am wanting to pay with bitcoin for Mega.nz, i please kindly wondered what are ways to avoid paying on a debit card please to purchase bitcoin in a wallet, is there any other methods that you kindly are aware of please? If anyone kindly had any thoughts on this i would be forever grateful and thankful it would mean the world to me.Thank you very much for any support you can give. I truly hope you have a wonderful week and that you remain very happy. Sending you lots of good wishes and i truly hope you have a wonderful and happy life. With my every best wishes.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: You can actually make a subscription using Bitcoin payment.When you are checking out, there is an option to purchase using a voucher. Select purchase voucher, and you will be redirected to a website for resellers (https://mega.io/resellers)Select https://cloudbasedbackup.com/mega, select the plan you would love and on the page to place an order, you will see an option to make payment using cryptocurrencies among other payment methods.

The P2P marketplace has those information in user chat log too. They surely have access to user chat information, for user disputes and other things. This means, your privacy is lost after you publish in online, even in P2P trades and in user chat for a trade.QuoteSince we are a community here who understand privacy, I am sure there is nothing to worry about here.It's wrong belief. It's your individual issue, your privacy and you can not rely on community to defend your privacy. There are not all members in the forum community care about privacy.

I understand your concerns about privacy and anonymity when storing sensitive personal and business data. It's wise to be cautious and explore options that minimize your digital footprint. Here's a breakdown of ways to purchase Bitcoin without using a debit card, along with considerations for using Mega.nz:Methods to Purchase Bitcoin Without a Debit Card:Cash Transactions (Peer-to-Peer):Platforms like LocalBitcoins (though less popular now) or Bisq facilitate direct trades between individuals. You can find sellers willing to accept cash in person.Pros: High level of anonymity if done carefully.Cons: Risks associated with meeting strangers, potential for scams, and the need to handle large sums of cash.Bitcoin ATMs:These machines allow you to purchase Bitcoin using cash.Pros: Relatively quick and easy.Cons: Often have higher fees, and some may require phone number verification.Prepaid Cards:Some online exchanges or peer-to-peer platforms might accept prepaid cards. You can purchase these cards with cash at various retail locations.Pros: Adds a layer of anonymity compared to debit cards.Cons: Fees can be high, and availability may be limited.Gift Cards:Some platforms allow the purchase of bitcoin using gift cards.Pros: Can be purchased with cash.Cons: Fees can be very high, and limited availability.
